title: Alternate Reality Game-Based Capstone Design: Language Project Development

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational game design principles and general understanding of linguistics
context.additional_context: Students work in teams to solve simulations and real-world problems, designing and implementing Alternate Reality Games (ARGs) using digital tools. Assessment focuses on project outcomes, developing language-based solutions for global issues.

learning_goals: Students can develop a language-learning ARG (Alternate Reality Game) prototype by applying the ARG design process.
Teams can propose creative solutions to global issues (e.g., language education for digitally marginalized groups) using problem-based learning (PBL) methodology.
Learners can submit game design documents (proposal, storyboard, evaluation metrics) and implementation results through project-based assessments.

resources: Game Development Tools (Unity/RPG Maker Free Version)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
